page.title: 11RELIGION
page.content:
There are churches for both the Church of England and the Church of Rome.
Meopham Church. Meopham Church is built of flint, stone and brick. It is large and has a tall tower, it is used by the surrounding area for Church Parades and gatherings. There are some old stained glass windows, depicting St. George, St. Thomas a Becket and Catherine with the wheel.Services are held are held twice every Sunday, there is a Sunday School, Mothers Union and other clubs. The vicar lives opposite. St. Paul's Church. The new Roman Catholic Church of St. Paul's is moderately well attended and it stands near the new shops and estates. It holds two services on Sundays.
